PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;
Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) Atypical chest pain
OTHER DIAGNOSIS ;
Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment / Stay
s / p inferior STEMI ( 2/17 ) with stent to RCA ; TTE ( 2/17 ) - LVEF 55-60% , inferobasal HK ; cervical spinal stenosis ; hypothyroidism ; GERD ; endometriosis s / p laparotomy and L oophorectomy .
OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES :
none
OTHER TREATMENTS / PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. )
ETT - MIBI 5/27/05 - normal , no e / o ischemia .
BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE :
45 yo F s / p recent inferior STEMI ( 2/17 ) w/ 100% RCA stented -> 0% , and residual LAD / Diag1/LCx / OM2 disease .
Developed burning chest pain before bedtime the night PTA .
NO associated sxs / radiation .
Slept well , but on the am of admission had same burning across chest ( " deeper than heartburn " ) so went to her MD 's office .
Transient diaphoresis in MD 's office that patient attributed to heat in room .
Patient says pain is similar in location and quality to the pain she had with her MI , although with her MI the pain was much more intense ( 20x worse ) .
This is 1st pain since MI ( though patient reports chronic baseline chest tightness x8-10 years of unclear etiology ) .
CP / burning lasted several hours and was relieved after she received Maalox , lidocaine , and NTG in the ED .
She reports compliance with her ASA + plavix .
She is active at baseline , participating in cardiac rehab for 2 hrs / week and running up and down stairs at home without CP / SOB .
IN ED vitals p86 bp 127/88 sat 100% .
NAD .
No JVD .
CTAB. nl s1s2 , reg , no m / r. no chest tenderness .
abd soft , NT / ND , NABS. ext wwp , no c / c/e , 2+DP 's b / l.
labs :
A set :
trop < assay , CK 67 , MB 0.2 .
EKG - old TWI III .
A / P :
45F with recent inferior STEMI s / p stent to RCA .
1. CV :
( I ) ROMI negative .
ETT MIBI 4/14 without e / o ischemia . ?
GERD as etiology of her chest burning .
cont asa , statin , plavix , bblkr .
( P ) Most recent echo :
EF 55% and inf / post HK .
( R ) Patient had no events on tele .
2. ENDO :
continue levoxyl for hypothyroidism , synarel for endometriosis .
3. MSK :
cervical spondylosis , tylenol for pain .
4. GI :
h / o GERD- nexium .
FULL CODE ADDITIONAL COMMENTS :
If you develop recurrent chest pain , shortness of breath , or any other concerning symptoms , call your doctor or return to the hospital .
Continue taking all of your regular home medications .
Follow up with Dr. Koteskismanhout in July .
DISCHARGE CONDITION :
Stable
TO DO / PLAN :
No dictated summary
ENTERED BY :
SAGELYSS , TYTUMZE V. , M.D. ( FS69 ) 05/27/05 05:33 PM
****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
